data.title: Great onion rings!!!!!!
data.text: The place to go if you enjoy thinly sliced onion rings! The pork tenderloin sandwiches are also incredible. Have both and be in foodie paradise!

data.title: Not as good as it use to be
data.text: Unfortunately, the food has gotten skimpy - the pizza with the works we were told was topped with less stuff because now they measure everything and it is a lot less then before.  The prices for these thin crust, few topping pizza's is also too expensive for what they are.  So disappointing that they are just not as good as they use to be!

data.title: An old favorite gets worse every time.
data.text:
I have been going to this restaurant for over 30 years. I hate to say that it gets worse every time I go. I keep going back thinking that the cook must have had a bad day, or someone didn't show up leaving the place short-handed. But today was so awful that I am done coming back (I'll go to their location on 50th Street instead).  Today, the restaurant smelled like beer and smoke and just bad when we walked in. We are used to the dated decor, so that isn't a issue. We were placed a room with one other group who was almost done eating. We waited for 10 minutes as other staff, including the hostess, walked around us cleaning and talking, I.e. Not even acknowledging our existence. As we decided to leave thinking no one was going to wait on us, a waitress working the only other table with customers asked if anyone had helped us. Another waiter, Tom, was apparently assigned to our section and apparently was nowhere to be found. She was kind and waited in us, later only to be chastised by a man I assume was manager of some sort who noted that her cleaning was not all done (she was cleaning when I heard the comment).  She was polite and worked faster.  

My chicken salad was awful.  There was so much dressing that I couldn't tell the difference between the croutons and the bland chicken. I ate a third of it. The calzone was unevenly cooked and small. The onion rings were great, as always. The sub and fries were okay. We do usually order pizza here.  That is all one should order if coming here. 

To add to the cruddy food and environment, the staff (other than the gal waiting on us) was disheveled and several folks not looking professional kept going and out of the kitchen area. It made me wonder if our bad food was made by them. 

I only recall one other restaurant review that I've given a rating like this. But after probably 10 chances over a couple of years giving the benefit of the doubt, I will not go back here again. 

The only bright light was the young lady who covered for Tom and waited on us.

data.title: Lunch while shopping
data.text: Stopped in for lunch while shopping with my wife and friends.  Best calzone I've had in years.  Wait staff was very friendly and attentive.  Their onion rings are really more like onion strings, but they are outstanding on flavor.

data.title: Valley Junction Pizza
data.text: We stopped here for lunch after a morning of shopping in Valley Junction. Staff, especially our server, were friendly, efficient, and attentive. Our glasses never were less than half full. Lunch pizza was very good and fried chicken not too greasy. Both were served hot. We were quite pleased.

data.title: Good local pizza
data.text: Ate with some friends and split a pizza and onion rings. The onion rings are great as is the thin crust pizza. It is an old school family pizza place with friendly staff and very reasonable prices. Good place to eat with friends and family. The kids had wings but they were a little hot and spicy for one of them.

data.title: We love this place and eat here frequently.
data.text: Great pizza and Italian sandwitches.  They also have gelato.  Prices are reasonable and service is always good.

data.title: Back home specialty!
data.text: Back home to visit & always have to have a childhood favorite - Grinder!  Of course - not disappointed!!!!

data.title: Been there forever
data.text: This long-time restaurant serves tasty pizza and other Italian dishes.  Great for families, large groups, there is a separate room for large groups.

data.title: OK food in Valley Junction
data.text: Not many dining choices in Valley Junction, this place is OK if you're looking for a simple sandwich or salad.

data.title: Not sure why it's so popular
data.text: The pizza here isn't that great, neither are the other menu items. I don't know why it's so popular. Beer choices are very limited.

data.title: Great chicken salad and Guinea Grinders
data.text: We told the waitress we had only 45 minutes to dine before we had to leave. While the food was there in reasonable time, the waitress never checked back to see if we needed anything. The other wait staff were good at cleaning off used dishes. We had to ask for the bill to be brought. Otherwise the food was good.

data.title: Both places great, parking a little easier at 50th street.
data.text: Both location great, but parking a bit easier at the 50th street location.  Italian grinder pizza is my favorite menu item.

data.title: Nostalgic; great service, good food, nice size portions
data.text: Love to go to old mainstay eateries that have been in business for years and years and withstood the hard test of time.  Food is always good and service is great.  Good old fashioned Italian-American menu that won't disappoint!

data.title: Pizza Lunch
data.text: Have a great lunch pizza special, you get a small personal pizza with salad and a drink.  The grinder is also a favorite here.

data.title: both locations are delicious
data.text: this is a mainstay for des moiners.  the valley junction location is a tasty dive that is small and good for lunch in my opinion.  the newer location is bigger and better for crowds.  We have held parties here, and i think it's the top for pizza places in dsm and the western suburbs.

data.title: Twelve years since
data.text:
I moved from West Des Moines in 2003, I was in town for the weekend. I picked up my son and headed there for supper. It was really good I had the Ruben sandwich I forgot how good they make them. I should have taken one to go to take back to North 
East Tn. Maybe next time.

data.title: Pizza and MORE
data.text: The pizza here is excellent but expensive. A large Works Pizza will run you $20. They have good wings, salads, etc. The issue I have with both locations is the cleanliness. I have a habit of taking a peek into the kitchen at restaurants and these two need to be visited by the health inspector more frequently.

data.title: Good food in spite of poor service, seemingly lack of organization
data.text: My daughter and I visited this location for a late (1:45) lunch Sunday, February 8th, 2015. We were greeted immediately by the host who seemed frazzled, at best. He dropped two menus on the table as he walked past shouting at the staff asking who was going to wait on us. The waitress did a fine job. Our order took more than 30 minutes to arrive. We were told by our waitress our food had been taken to another table by mistake so they were making fresh food for us. At on point the man wearing the purple shirt who seated us had one of the wait staff by the arm pulling her to the kitchen. The food was fabulous but the atmosphere was strained at best. Will not return to this location.

data.title: Always the Best
data.text: It's been 20 years since I ate at the Tavern, but it was better than I remembered. First you need to order a Grinder. It is the best sandwhich on earth!!!! Then order a sausage pizza, its the best pizza on earth!!! Seriously great food!
